Hand-Drawn Maps!

These days with most maps being made on the computer, Maptime Madison is going against the grain by kicking off with a session on hand-drawn maps. We’ll learn from @DylanMoriarty, a cartographer and illustrator (aka the “Bob Ross” of hand-drawn maps). We’ll go over the basic principles of cartography and put them to practice by making our own maps.

Maptime is inclusive - everyone is welcome and encouraged to join in on the fun!

Bob Ross clearly approves

Supplies

Supplies will be provided, but bring anything you like - paint, crayons, pastels, etc.

When and Where?

Wednesday Nov 5th 6pm - 8pm @ Madison Public Library: Central Library

201 W Mifflin St Madison, WI 53703

Join us: Wednesday, Nov 05 2014
RSVP

Welcome to Maptime Madison!

Maptime Madison is a monthly meetup for anyone that wants to learn about and make maps. People with all levels of mapping experience are encouraged to join. Maptime is a place for learning and a time to work collaboratively on mapping projects.

Events will be hosted in the Madison downtown area - locations and times will be posted to this site. If you have any suggestions about Maptime Madison or want to get involved let us know @MaptimeMadison or shoot us an email at maptimemadison@gmail.com.

Happy Mapping and we hope to see you at an event!

Organizers

Katie Kowalsky, @KatieKowalsky
Rashauna Mead, @RashaunaMead
Robin Tolochko, @ToloMaps
